author: eKon
post_text: November 12, 2015 at 4:51 AM#1Hi,Most of the time i'm creating more then 1 dimmer line in an FX just to get it really smooth.Is there anyway you can write a macro so you get an Popup at firstWhat attribute's you want to add? Should be cool if you could say dimmer & PositionHow many lines you want to add?Wondering if someone can help me out with it.

posts.author: eKon
posts.post_text: November 12, 2015 at 4:51 AM#1Hi,Most of the time i'm creating more then 1 dimmer line in an FX just to get it really smooth.Is there anyway you can write a macro so you get an Popup at firstWhat attribute's you want to add? Should be cool if you could say dimmer & PositionHow many lines you want to add?Wondering if someone can help me out with it.

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: January 21, 2016 at 11:54 AM#2hisetvar $fx = (which effect ?)setvar $line = (which line ?)setvar $attr = (wich attribute ?)store effect $fx ------------------- to create the effectstore effect 1.$fx.$line /m ------------ to create the lineassign attribute $"attr" at effect 1.1.$line ------------------ to assign attributeEnjoy

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: January 22, 2016 at 7:06 PM#3little correction : assign attribue $"attr" at effect 1.$fx.lineEnjoy

title: Adding Attributes in FX Thru Macro's
